1.text: And Job will answer and say,

2.text: How didst thou help to him of no strength? didst thou save the arm of no strength?

3.text: How didst thou counsel to him of no wisdom? and didst thou make known help for abundance?

4.text: And with whom didst thou announce words? and whose breath came forth from thee?

5.text: The shades shall tremble from under the waters, and their inhabitants.

6.text: Hades is naked before him, and no covering to destruction.

7.text: He stretched out the north upon emptiness, he hung up the earth upon nothing.

8.text: He bound up the waters in his clouds, and the cloud was not rent under them.

9.text: Holding fast the face of the throne, he spread his cloud upon it.

10.text: He marked out with a compass the law upon the face of the waters, even till the end of light with darkness.

11.text: The pillars of the heavens shall be shaken, and be astonished from his reproof.

12.text: By his power he caused the sea to tremble; by his understanding he smote through pride.

13.text: By his spirit he polished the heavens; his hand pierced the flat serpent.

14.text: Behold these the ends of his ways; how transient a sound of the word was heard in him! and the thunder of his might who shall understand?
